bug.author: mikebenfield
bug.description:
Possibly I am misunderstanding something, but it looks like the "sentences" spacy finds are just individual words. <denchmark-code>In [1]: import spacy
In [2]: nlp = spacy.load('en')
In [3]: doc = nlp('Hello, world. Here is a second sentence.')
In [4]: sentence = next(doc.sents)
In [5]: sentence.text Out[5]: 'Hello' </denchmark-code>
If I understand the documentation, this should be 'Hello, world.'

comments.comment: Hi, Did you download and install the data?
If downloading the data means doing sudo python -m spacy.en.download all, yes, I did.
Hmm. Have a look within the package directory, and check that the data is actually there. sudo can be tricksy with Python, because it fiddles with your environment variables.
